PLAYER ACTION: , please take a Long Rest and enter Initiative. There is no Combat, currently. But we are entering a Skill challenge to track the beast through the swamp. On your "Turn" you will describe what you are doing throughout the day to help and aid in this endeavor through narration in . You may use any ability, trait, or spell you like, if it is finite be sure to expend it appropriately. After you have described this you will choose a skill that fits those actions and make a check using that skill. The DC for success is set. Using the same skill as the player just before you in initiative will increase the DC. Using the Same skill as your own previous turn will increase the DC. Particularly good roleplay or creative and justified Skill choice will lower the DC. If I find your skill choice does not fit properly with your described actions I will call for a different Skill check. Your are given a certain lenience in this challenge to create minor aspects of the world. You may feel free to describe the presence of certain terrain features befitting of a swamp. Refrain from describing the presence of any animals or other creatures that have not been introduced through narration. After each turn and check I will elaborate on what that particular success or failure looked like and the consequences of that. The goal is to track the beast. Achieving this goal is inevitable. But the condition in which they are found or that you are in when you find them will be determined by the outcome of this challenge. please use `!i join -p 10` Alright, that's everyone. PLAYER ACTION: yes, you would not moved, and actually as the broom slammed into you it now lies in your space. The main thing now is to determine if the broom breaks from the damage. A broom is a tiny resilient object. it thus has 2d4 hp. Being magical it has resistance to all damage, so would take 7 damage. It also has magic resilience, and as an uncommon item with a threshold of 10. So it did not take enough damage to break from the schock. Had the catapult spell done 20+ damage, it would have broken the broom on impact... As a last note, the broom could be held if the rider chooses so by using a free action to grab it, but it does not need to be held for it to work. Actually Cordelia would still have taken damage as the broom slammed into her. well the broom would have hit cordelia first as it was in its space, and thus remained in that space.
